name: Startup SG Founder
description: Startup SG Founder provides mentorship and startup capital grant of S$50,000 to first-time entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas. Startups are required to commit S$10,000 as co-matching fund to the grant.

name: Startup SG Tech
description: Startup SG Tech supports Proof-of-Concept (POC) and Proof-of-Value (POV) for commercialisation of innovative technologies.

name: 5G Open Testbed
description: Companies would be able to trial their solutions at these 5G testbeds before they embark on their journey towards commercialisation as part of our efforts to convert Singapore into an innovation hub for 5G.

name: Digital Integration Incentive
description: The Digital Integration Incentive aims to increase the market supply of software integrated with seamless tax filing and e-invoicing capabilities; and drive end-business adoption of these software. This is part of IRAS’ ongoing efforts to facilitate the fulfilment of tax-related obligations through taxpayers’ natural systems.

name: Growth and Transformation Scheme
description: Supports initiatives that build best-in-class capabilities and enable holistic transformation for value chains in the Building & Construction sector.

name: LEAD Connect Grant
description: A $30k fixed grant applicable to large enterprises with their own finance/ ERP solution.

name: LEAD Transact Grant
description: Up to a $40k grant by IMDA applies to large enterprises that meet the minimum number of transacting business partners on the InvoiceNow network.

name: Maritime Innovation and Technology Fund (MINT)
description: The Maritime Innovation and Technology Fund (MINT) aims to support and grow Singapore’s maritime innovation and technology ecosystem. There are three funding schemes available: MINT-Research & Development (MINT-RD), MINT-Product Development (MINT-PD) and MINT-Startup Grant (MINT-STARTUP).

name: Operation & Technology Roadmap (OTR)
description: Development of technology roadmaps to map out priorities that are aligned to businesses’ strategies and developmental plans.

name: Partnerships for Capability Transformation
description: The enhanced Partnerships for Capability Transformation scheme will support more collaborations between multinational corporations, large local enterprises, and SMEs, including capability training, internationalisation and corporate venturing.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
description: The PSG supports businesses in the adoption of productivity solutions. Businesses can choose from a list of pre-scoped solutions and receive up to 50% funding support for eligible costs.

name: Public Sector Construction Productivity Fund
description: The Public Sector Construction Productivity Fund (PSCPF) was introduced to support public agencies by funding the construction cost premium incurred for adopting Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DfMA) technologies by public sector projects.

name: Start Digital
description: SMEs new to using digital technology can adopt any 2 solutions e.g. Digital Marketing, Digital Collaboration, Accounting, HR/Payroll, Cybersecurity, etc., at no cost for at least 6 months (min. 18 months contract).

name: SG Cyber Talent Development Fund
description: To support communities, associations and industry partners to develop new ground up initiatives; sustain meaningful initiatives and scale impactful initiatives that aim to engage, build and advance the cybersecurity workforce and ecosystem. The Fund will support 3 tiers of initiatives (1) community events and projects (2) skill development and recognition projects (3) training and job placement programmes.

name: Technology for Enterprise Capability Upgrading (T-Up)
description: Get access to talents from A*STAR’s Research Institutes and build in-house R&D capabilities.

name: Grow Digital
description: SMEs that are ready to sell overseas can receive funding support when they participate in pre-approved Business-to-Business (B2B) and Business-to-Consumer (B2C) e-commerce platforms with global or regional reach.

name: Local Enterprise and Association Development (LEAD) Programme
description: TACs keen to drive capability development and internationalisation projects can tap on LEAD programme. LEAD supports up to 70% of eligible costs for qualifying projects.

name: Market Readiness Assistance (MRA) Grant
description: SMEs looking to take their business overseas can receive up to 70% support for eligible costs with the MRA grant from 1 April 2020 - 31 March 2023.

name: Building & Construction Transformation Gross Floor Area Incentive Scheme
description: Aims to encourage greater adoption of enhanced Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM) standards in areas of digitalisation, productivity and sustainability (“ITM Outcome Requirements”) in private sector developments.

name: Cities of Tomorrow (CoT) R &D programme
description: Research programme that works with industry and research partners to co-develop innovative solutions and technologies to provide green and sustainability solutions.

name: Electric Vehicle Common Charger Grant (ECCG)
description: The scheme is introduced to kickstart the installation of shared charging infrastructure in non-landed private residences (NLPRs).

name: Green Mark Incentive Scheme for Existing Buildings 2.0 (GMIS-EB 2.0)
description: Provide grant support to building owners on their goals to attain higher energy performance by lowering the upfront capital costs for energy efficiency retrofits and improve the returns on investment, particularly for buildings meeting Super Low Energy or Zero Energy standards.

name: Skyrise Greenery Incentive Scheme
description: Skyrise Greenery Incentive Scheme (SGIS) was introduced to increase the greenery provision in Singapore by encouraging the installation of new skyrise greenery on existing buildings.

name: Sustainable Bond Grant Scheme
description: Offsets up to S$125,000 of expenses incurred for external reviews of eligible green, social, sustainability, sustainability-linked as well as transition bonds and promotes the adoption of internationally-recognised standards and taxonomies.

name: SkillsFuture For Business
description: Find all SkillsFuture-supported programmes and grants in one place.

name: e-Adviser for Skills Training
description: For business owners to get personalised recommendations on skills training courses and SkillsFuture initiatives relevant to your business as part of the SkillsFuture Movement.

name: Absentee Payroll (AP) Funding
description: Defray some manpower costs incurred when you send your employees for training courses funded by SkillsFuture (SSG). Capped at $100,000 per organisation annually.

name: Career Trial
description: Allows companies to assess jobseekers’ job fit through a short-term trial, before formal employment. Government will provide training allowance to the jobseekers for the trial period (up to 3 months).

name: Company-Led Training (CLT) Programme
description: CLT accelerates professional development through on-the-job training programme for fresh to mid-level professionals acquiring competencies for jobs in demand by industry, especially the Digital Economy sector.

name: Employment Support for Ex-Offenders
description: This programme equips ex-offenders with industry skills to prepare them for re-integration into the workforce.

name: Employment Support for Persons with Disabilities
description: Hire, train and integrate Persons with Disabilities into the workforce. Receive course fee subsidies of up to 90% for SG Enable’s list of curated training courses.

name: Enabling Employment Credit
description: The Enabling Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring persons with disabilities.

name: Enhanced Training Support for SMEs (ETSS)
description: Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) receive up to 90% course fee subsidy for employer-sponsored training under selected SSG-supported courses. SME status is derived automatically from government data. No application is required.

name: Part-Time Re-employment Grant (PTRG)
description: Provides funding support to companies that voluntarily commit to providing part-time re-employment to all eligible seniors who request for it.

name: Progressive Wage Credit Scheme
description: Provides transitional support to employers for Progressive Wages moves, by co-funding wage increases of lower-wage workers between 2022 and 2026.

name: Senior Employment Credit
description: No application is required. The Senior Employment Credit provides wage offsets to help employers that employ workers aged 55 and above adjust to the higher Retirement Age and Re-employment Age.

name: SkillsFuture Work-Study Programmes (WSPs)
description: Businesses can groom and hire fresh talent through Work-Study Programmes across Certificate, Diploma, Post-Diploma, and Degree levels. Businesses will jointly design and deliver with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and appointed private providers.

name: Uplifting Employment Credit
description: The Uplifting Employment Credit provides wage offsets to employers hiring ex-offenders.

name: 3R Fund
description: The 3R Fund supports companies and organisations registered in Singapore to implement waste minimisation and recycling projects to reduce solid waste sent for disposal.

name: Future Energy Fund
description: The Future Energy Fund supports infrastructure investments for energy transition to net-zero future.

name: Sustainability Reporting Grant
description: The Sustainability Reporting Grant will provide funding support for large companies with annual revenue $100 million and above, to cover a portion of their costs in producing their first sustainability report in Singapore.

name: Water Efficiency Fund (WEF)
description: WEF provides funding to local non-domestic water users to enable them to improve water efficiency through water efficiency assessment, pilot study, recycling, adoption of water efficient equipment & industrial water solution demonstration projects.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (EDG)
description: The EDG helps Singapore companies grow and transform. This grant supports projects that help you upgrade your business, innovate or venture overseas. Receive up to 70% support for eligible costs.

name: Agri-Food Cluster Transformation (ACT) Fund
description: The Agri-Food Cluster Transformation (ACT) Fund supports local food-producing companies in their efforts to expand production capabilities, boost yield, raise productivity, sustainability and improve circularity.

name: Accessibility Fund
description: Building owners can receive up to 80% support for upgrading their existing buildings with essential accessibility features.

name: Construction Productivity & Capability Fund - Technology Adoption (Productivity Innovation Project)
description: The PIP scheme aims to defray the cost of adopting Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DfMA) and Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD) technologies.

name: Productivity Innovation Project (PIP)
description: Construction related companies can defray the cost of technology adoption aimed to help reduce site workers or improve site productivity.

name: Early Childhood Industry Digital Plan
description: A step-by-step guide for local SMEs in the Early Childhood industry on the digital solutions to adopt and relevant training for your employees at each stage of your growth.

name: Power Systems Competitive Research and Test-bedding (CRT) Funding Initiatives
description: EMA rolls out competitive grant calls to catalyse applied research and development (R&D) of innovative technologies and solutions. This aims to address industry-relevant challenges and opportunities in the energy sector that lead to long-term solutions for Singapore’s energy challenges. The Power Systems CRT Funding Initiatives support competitive R&D grant call projects and test-beds in the three areas of natural gas, energy storage and future grid that will to support the Singapore Green Plan 2030 and Long-Term Low-Emissions Development Strategy.

name: Asian Financial Leaders Scheme (AFLS)
description: The AFLS initiative helps FIs defray part of the costs incurred in sending promising C-1/C-2 Singaporean finance professionals on eligible leadership programmes.

name: Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) FinTech Grant
description: Empower financial institutions in addressing their key ESG data and infrastructure challenges, supporting their mobilising of capital towards sustainable activities and tracking of their net zero transition plans and programmes. The FSTI scheme is valid until March 2026.

name: Financial Sector Technology and Innovation Scheme (FSTI 3.0) Centre of Excellence Grant
description: Supports financial institutions, Corporate Venture Capital entities (CVCs) and global Technology companies to set up centres of excellence in Singapore to test-bed innovative ideas and roll out market solutions.

name: Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Scheme - Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics (AIDA) Grant
description: The AIDA grant supports projects that demonstrate adoption of AI & DA techniques that achieve business objectives of strategy & decision making with consideration of workforce impact.

name: Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Scheme - Industry-wide Technological Infrastructure or Utility
description: The FSTI Industry-wide Projects scheme seeks to build industry-wide technological/utility infrastructure and/or improve efficiency and boost productivity in the financial services sector.

name: Financial Training Scheme (FTS)
description: The FTS provides funding for financial sector-specific training programmes which are recognized under FTS.

name: FSTI Innovation Acceleration - Early Innovation
description: Provides funding support for experimentation, development and dissemination of nascent innovative technologies in the financial services sector. The FSTI Scheme is valid until March 2026.

name: Grant for Equity Market Singapore (GEMS) - Research Talent Development
description: The GEMS Research Talent Development track supports financial institutions in developing equity research capabilities.

name: Institute of Banking and Finance Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS)
description: The IBF-STS provides funding for programmes accredited under the IBF standards.

name: Regulatory Technology Grant
description: Support financial institutions based in Singapore to enhance the efficiency of their risk management and compliance functions through the use of technological solutions.

name: International Postings Programme (iPOST)
description: The iPOST initiative helps FIs defray part of the costs incurred in sending Singapore citizen staff on global and regional attachments or postings.

name: Energy Efficiency Grant (EEG)
description: The Energy Efficiency Grant (EEG) aims to help businesses within the Food Services, Manufacturing or Retail sectors to cope with rising energy costs, through co-funding investments in more energy-efficient equipment.

name: Hawkers Go Digital
description: Bonus of $300 per month over 5 months to be given to stallholders in hawker centres, wet markets, coffee shops and industrial canteen to encourage adoption of e-payments.

name: Healthier Dining Grant
description: The Healthier Dining Grant is a funding scheme which empowers Healthier Dining Programme Partners to publicise their healthier menu options either online or offline.

name: Healthier Dining Innovation Grant (HDI)
description: HDI is a funding scheme of up to $5,000 for F&B operators to take their first step towards capability upgrading in 4 areas: R&D, Purchase of Healthier Ingredients, Culinary Training, and Recipe Reformulation.

name: Healthier Ingredient Development Scheme (HIDS)
description: HIDS is a Healthy Choice Symbol Development Grant that incentivises food ingredient manufacturers/suppliers to develop greater varieties of healthier ingredients for adoption among F&B businesses and consumers. The scheme funds up to 80% qualifying project costs, cap at $200,000.

name: Healthier Ingredient Promotion Scheme (HIPS)
description: HIPS is a Go-To-Market grant that incentivises food ingredient manufacturers/suppliers to promote the adoption of healthier ingredients, among F&B businesses and consumers. The scheme funds up to 80% qualifying project costs, cap at $300,000.

name: Marine and Offshore Engineering Industry Digital Plan
description: A step-by-step guide for local SMEs in the Marine and Offshore Engineering industry on the digital solutions to adopt and relevant training for your employees at each stage of your growth.

name: Resource Efficiency Grant for Energy (REG(E))
description: REG(E) encourages companies with manufacturing or data centre activities to implement projects that improve energy efficiency or reduce non-CO2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.

name: Maritime Cluster Fund (MCF) - Business Development
description: MCF-Business Development is available to support eligible expenses incurred by maritime companies and organisations in the setting up of new maritime-related businesses or expansion; into new lines of maritime functions in Singapore, and internationalisation efforts by the maritime companies. MCF-Business Development is a co-funding grant scheme available to qualifying maritime players committed to growing and succeeding in Singapore.

name: Tech Subsidy - Social Service Agencies
description: This scheme is to empower social service agencies with Technology. This scheme is only applicable to NCSS Members and MSF-funded agencies.

name: Service Industry Transformation Programme (SITP)
description: This programme aims to support lifestyle sector enterprises in their transformation efforts and to uplift organisational capabilities in innovation, job redesign and manpower planning.

name: Business Events in Singapore (BEiS)
description: The BEiS scheme seeks to encourage the business events industry to anchor and grow quality events as well as catalyse the innovation of new content.

name: Business Improvement Fund (BIF)
description: The BIF aims to encourage technology innovation and adoption, redesign of business model and processes in the tourism sector to improve productivity and competitiveness. STB has expanded BIF to include sustainability initiatives in support of our tourism companies in their sustainability journey to build resource efficiencies, pivot business models to enhance competitiveness, scale up adoption and development of sustainable solutions and pursue sustainability certification across the tourism industries.

name: Cruise Development Fund (CDF)
description: The CDF supports cruise industry players in activities that will build strong consumer demand for cruises from Singapore.

name: Experience Step-Up Fund (ESF)
description: The ESF supports development and enhancement of Singapore’s tourism experiences that increase the attractiveness of Singapore to visitors.

name: Kickstart Fund (KF)
description: The KF supports the creation and test-bedding of innovative consumer-focused concepts and events with strong tourism potential and scalability. This is with the aim of adding to the existing quality tourism software and enhancing the vibrancy of Singapore as a tourist destination.

name: Leisure Events Fund (LEF)
description: The LEF supports the launch and development of world-class, differentiated, and celebrated leisure event experiences in Singapore so as to deliver key tourism outcomes and to contribute towards the agenda of establishing Singapore into one of the world’s most vibrant cities.

name: Tourism Product Development Fund (TPDF)
description: The TPDF supports the creation, development of new tourism products and/or major rejuvenation of existing tourism products to increase Singapore destination attractiveness to visitors.

name: Training Industry Professionals in Tourism (TIP-iT)
description: The TIP-iT supports tourism companies in employee upgrading and leadership development, including training in sustainability-related areas.

name: 5G Grant | 5G Innovation Programme
description: IMDA is looking to support 5G use cases in the four strategic clusters of (i) Maritime Operations; (ii) Urban Mobility; (iii...

name: IRAS Digital Integration Incentive (DII)
description: IRAS introduced the Digital Integration Incentive (DII) to incentivise software developers to accelerate integration of IRAS APIs for Corporate Income Tax Returns (Form C-S) and GST Returns (GST F5, F8) as well as e-invoicing capabilities, thereby attaining the IRAS ASR+ Tier 3 status.

name: Growth and Transformation Scheme (GTS)
description: The Growth and Transformation Scheme (GTS) encourages and supports the formation of strategic alliances among developers, consultants, builders, and sub-contractors across the value chain. It aims to enable companies to reap the benefits of taking a longer-term view on business and workforce transformation, supporting partnership efforts to strengthen technical capabilities and corporate, digital, and innovation practices.

name: InvoiceNow Accelerate
description: InvoiceNow Accelerate is a newly launched programme in April 2024 to provide newly incorporated businesses a head-start in their digitalisation journey with one year of free InvoiceNow services. The programme supports the growth of these businesses by equipping them with basic digital tools in e-invoicing from the onset.

name: MINT-Research & Product Development (MINT-RPD)
description: This scheme supports applied R&D, product development and test-bedding of technology relevant to the maritime industry and encourages development of maritime technology and IP/patent and capabilities development. Relevant outcomes include new technology and services developed and deployed for the maritime industry with researchers, engineers and scientists trained in the new maritime technology capabilities.
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: MINT-Startup Grant (MINT-STARTUP)
description: This scheme encourages the maritime industry to accelerate innovation and venture into adjacent/ new growth areas through working with tech start-ups. Start-ups that have completed the PIER71™ or other relevant maritime programmes from the Accelerator Partners of MPA in Singapore can apply for a grant of up to S$100,000 to carry out POC, POV or pilot projects.
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: Partnerships for Capability Transformation (PACT)
description: The Partnerships for Capability Transformation (PACT) scheme was introduced in 2010 to defray part of costs - such as on equipment, materials, testing and professional services - incurred by original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and their suppliers, to validate that suppliers’ procedures comply with the OEM’s requirements. PACT also provides wage support for managers hired by the OEMs to undertake supplier identification, procurement and setting up of manufacturing/quality systems. The scheme supports productivity improvements, knowledge transfer, and test-bedding of innovative solutions and covers co-innovation activities such as joint product development by large enterprises and suppliers at the proof-of-concept stage. PACT also supports consortium partnerships in which companies would come together and pursue common business development opportunities. In addition, PACT facilitates efforts by Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) to adopt or incorporate niche technologies into their processes or products.

name: Built Environment Accelerate to Market Programme
Green Mark Incentive Scheme for New Buildings (GMIS-NB)
Workforce Training and Upgrading Online System (WTUS)
TeSA for ITE and Polytechnics (TIP) Alliance
description: The TIP Alliance aims to equip ITE and Polytechnic students and graduates with skills to take up tech job opportunities and share...

name: TechSkills Accelerator (TeSA)
description: An initiative of SkillsFuture, TechSkills Accelerator (TeSA) aims to build and develop a skilled Information and Communications...

name: Tech Immersion and Placement Programme (TIPP)
description: The Tech Immersion and Placement Programme (TIPP) aims to convert non-ICT professionals into industry-ready ICT professionals.

name: T-Up Programme
description: T-Up programme seconds A*STAR scientists and research engineers to aid in local SMEs’ Research and Development projects for up to two years. Seconded experts share product development strategy, aid innovation in your business processes, and assist companies to develop innovative products. Eligible SMEs can apply for up to 70% grant from Enterprise Singapore to offset qualifying cost.

name: Grow Digital
description: Grow Digital, an initiative by the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) and Enterprise Singapore (ESG) under the SMEs Go Digital programme, offers SMEs digital solutions to expand their businesses through e-commerce platforms, both locally and overseas. By leveraging this initiative and other digitalisation efforts in Singapore, SMEs can participate in Business-to-Business (B2B) and Business-to-Consumer (B2C) e-commerce platforms to sell overseas without a need for physical presence.
agency: Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) and Enterprise Singapore (ESG)

name: Local Enterprise and Association Development (LEAD) Programme
description: For trade associations and chambers that aim to drive capability development and internationalisation projects for SMEs. Trade associations and chambers (TACs) are key enablers in enterprise upgrading and industry development. TACs keen to play a more active role in driving capability development and internationalisation projects can apply for the Local Enterprise and Association Development Programme (LEAD) programme.

name: Market Readiness Assistance (MRA) Grant
description: The Market Readiness Assistance (MRA) grant helps companies expand into new markets overseas by defraying the costs of overseas market promotion, business development and set-up. The enhanced MRA grant cap of up to S$100,000 will be extended until 31 March 2025.

name: Heartland Enterprise Placemaking Grant
description: The Heartland Enterprise Placemaking Grant (HEPG) encourages heartland merchants to organise innovative placemaking activities. These include community engagement activities, public art installations, workshops, and thematic festivals. These activities will complement regular events in the heartlands organised by the local Community Clubs and Merchants’ Associations, contributing to business growth and footfall in the heartlands.

name: Built Environment Transformation Gross Floor Area Incentive Scheme
description: The Built Environment Transformation Gross Floor Area (BE Transformation GFA) Incentive Scheme aims to encourage greater adoption of enhanced Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM) standards in areas of digitalisation, productivity and sustainability in private sector developments. Developers/building owners can enjoy up to 3% additional GFA allowed beyond the Master Plan Gross Plot Ratio for delivering the stipulated ITM Outcome Requirements in their building development on private sites of at least 5,000sqm GFA.

name: Electric Vehicle Common Charger Grant (ECCG)
description: LTA has launched the Electric Vehicle Common Charger Grant (ECCG) to kickstart the installation of shared charging infrastructure in non-landed private residences (NLPRs). The ECCG will co-fund installation costs of 2,000 EV chargers at NLPRs, as an early adoption incentive. As NLPRs form a significant proportion of residences in Singapore, improving charger provision and access is an important step towards improving the coverage of Singapore’s national EV charging network. At the 2021 Committee of Supply debates, the Government had announced a target to deploy 60,000 EV charging points by 2030, of which 20,000 will be in private premises such as NLPRs, and 40,000 in public carparks.

name: Green Mark Incentive Scheme for Existing Buildings 2.0 (GMIS-EB 2.0)
description: The $63-million Green Mark Incentive Scheme for Existing Buildings 2.0 aims to raise the energy performance of existing buildings and accelerate the transition to a low-carbon Built Environment. It provides grant support to building owners to attain higher energy performance by lowering upfront capital costs for energy efficiency retrofits, particularly for buildings meeting Super Low Energy or Zero Energy standards.

name: Building Retrofit Energy Efficiency Financing (BREEF) Scheme
Built Environment Transformation Gross Floor Area Incentive Scheme
Green Mark Gross Floor Area Incentive Scheme (GM-GFA)
Green Mark Incentive Scheme for Existing Buildings and Premises (GMIS-EBP)
Skyrise Greenery Incentive Scheme
description: The Skyrise Greenery Incentive Scheme (SGIS) provides funding of up to 50% of installation costs for rooftop greenery and vertical greenery projects on existing buildings, with a cap of $200 per square metre for rooftop greenery and $500 per square metre for vertical greenery. Projects will be assessed for SGIS based on the project’s merits and ability to contribute towards climate, ecological and social resilience goals.

name: Sustainable Bond Grant Scheme
description: MAS' Sustainable Bond Grant Scheme (SBGS) offsets up to S$125,000 for eligible green, social, sustainability, sustainability-linked, and transition bonds. The grant is valid till 31 December 2028.

name: Employment Support for Employers to hire Persons with Disabilities (PWDs)
description: Gain access to subsidies, grants, and employment facilitation services to help hire and integrate PWDs into the organisations. Benefits include course fee subsidy, job redesign grant, recruitment and job support services.

name: Employment Support for Employers to hire Seniors
description: To provide career advisory and job matching services to senior jobseekers aged 50 and above. Benefits include committed seniors looking for employment.

name: Environmental Services Job Redesign Initiative
description: Supporting ES enterprises to leverage job redesign to complement and sustain business and workforce transformation efforts. Benefits include curated support for the ES industry, access to professional JR consultancy, and job redesign reskilling salary support.

name: Hiring of Ex-offenders
description: Supported by Workforce Singapore and administered by Yellow Ribbon Singapore (YRSG), this programme aims to help ex-offenders become job-ready and prepare them for re-integration into the workforce.

name: Employment Support for Persons with Disabilities
description: Employment Support for Persons with Disabilities (PWDs) is a programme supported by Workforce Singapore and SkillsFuture Singapore. Administered by SG Enable, the programme aims to enhance employability and increase employment options for PWDs. Through this programme, PWDs can gain access to career advisory services, training courses and post placement job support.

name: New Part-Time Re-Employment Grant (PTRG)
description: The New PTRG provides up to $125,000 to employers who offer part-time re-employment, flexible work arrangements (FWAs) and structured career planning (SCP) to senior workers. This will provide more flexible work options to attract and retain senior workers, and encourage them to stay in the workforce.

name: 3R Fund
description: The 3R Fund is a co-funding scheme to encourage organisations to reduce waste disposed of at NEA's incineration plants and disposal facilities through the implementation of waste minimisation and recycling projects.

name: Environmental Services Productivity Solutions Grant (ES PSG)
Incentive to De-register Older Motorcycles [Closed for Applications]
Singapore Certified Energy Manager SCEM Programme
Meteorological Service Singapore Local Research Collaborations
Meteorological Service Singapore International Research Collaborations
Grant Call to automate the collection and pre-processing of soiled crockery for centralised dishwashing [Closed for applications]
Research Innovation and Enterprise (RIE) Funding Initiatives
Power Sector Carbon Capture and Storage Grant Call
description: Consultations on the Power Sector Carbon Capture and Storage Grant Call.

name: Award of Second Energy Storage System Grant Call
description: Grant call for the second energy storage system.

name: Energy Efficiency Grant (EEG)
description: The Energy Efficiency Grant (EEG) aims to support businesses in their sustainability journey by co-funding investments in energy-efficient equipment. It was first launched in 2022 for businesses in the food services, food manufacturing and retail sectors. Since its launch, almost 2,000 companies have tapped on EEG. We are enhancing EEG to include more sectors and provide additional support for companies with more ambitious plans to reduce their emissions.

name: Enterprise Financing Scheme (Green)
description: To support Singapore enterprises embarking on and accelerating their sustainability journey, Enterprise Singapore (EnterpriseSG) will extend the Enterprise Financing Scheme-Green (EFS-Green) by two years until 31 March 2026. It provides risk-sharing of 70% to support lending by partner financial institutions to qualified Singapore enterprises.

name: Sustainability Reporting Grant
description: This grant will provide funding support for large companies with annual revenue $100 million and above, to cover a portion of their costs in producing their first sustainability report in Singapore. The grant defrays up to 30% of qualifying costs, capped at the lower of S$150,000 per company or 30 per cent of the qualifying costs in the preparation of their first sustainability report.

name: Resource Efficiency Grant for Emissions (REG(E))
description: The Resource Efficiency Grant for Emissions (REG(E)) provides support for industrial facilities to undertake projects that improve their energy efficiency and reduce carbon emissions. EDB is enhancing the REG(E) by lowering the carbon abatement threshold from 500 tonnes per annum to 250 tonnes per annum.

name: Enterprise Development Grant (EDG)
description: The Enterprise Development Grant (EDG) supports projects that help you upgrade, innovate, grow and transform your business. Submit your individual project proposals with details on your business plans and project outcomes to take your business further. EDG funds qualifying project costs namely third-party consultancy fees, software and equipment, and internal manpower cost.

name: Accessibility Fund
description: To promote an accessible and inclusive built environment, the BCA Accessibility Fund provides grants to building owners for upgrading their existing buildings with essential accessibility and Universal Design features. Building owners, lessors who have the ownership right to upgrade the building and lessees who can carry out the upgrading works with the endorsement of the building owners/lessors are eligible to apply for this fund.

name: Productivity Innovation Project (PIP)
description: The Productivity Innovation Project (PIP) incentive scheme co-funds up to 70% of the costs for technology adoption and innovations that improve productivity at construction sites. As announced at MND’s COS 2024, the PIP scheme will be extended to 31 March 2025. The extension is intended to encourage enterprises to continue their productivity upgrading and digitalisation efforts. The scheme aims to defray the costs required to re-engineer processes or adopt labour-efficient construction technologies and encourage construction-related companies to embark on solution development projects that build up their capabilities as well as improve site productivity and reduce site workers.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
description: Eligible SMEs can receive funding support from the Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG) or other relevant grants to implement digital solutions in the Early Childhood IDP.

name: Power Sector Carbon Capture and Storage Grant Call
description: The Energy Market Authority (EMA) is inviting interested participants to submit proposals on conducting Power Sector Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS) feasibility studies for co-funding support.

name: EMA-JTC Grant Call to Accelerate Clean Energy Innovations on Jurong Island
EMA-ESG Grant Call to Develop and Test-bed Solutions for Mitigation of Solar Intermittency and Optimisation of Energy Through Demand-Side Management
Singapore Energy Grand Challenge (Industry and Research Community)
Second Energy Efficiency Grant Call for Power Generation Companies
Energy Efficiency Grant Call for Power Generation Companies
Asian Financial Leaders Scheme (AFLS)
description: The AFLS initiative helps financial institutions defray part of the costs incurred in sending promising Singaporean finance professionals on eligible leadership programmes. Its objective is to encourage the financial industry to develop its pool of future leaders, by sending them on eligible leadership programmes that would provide the knowledge to navigate the diverse business, regulatory, and legal environment in the region.

name: ESG FinTech Grant
description: The Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) FinTech grant was launched as part of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) scheme to spur the financial sector's adoption of ESG technology solutions. These solutions should empower financial institutions in addressing their key ESG data and infrastructure challenges, supporting their mobilising of capital towards sustainable activities and tracking of their net zero transition plans and programmes. The FSTI scheme is valid until March 2026 Applications will be approved up to March 2026. Approved projects can run beyond March 2026.

name: Centre of Excellence
description: The Centre of Excellence track seeks to attract financial institutions, Corporate Venture Capital entities (CVCs) and global Technology companies to set up centres of excellence in Singapore to test-bed innovative ideas and roll out market solutions.

name: Industry-wide Technological Infrastructure or Utility
description: The Industry-wide Projects track seeks to build industry-wide technological/ utility infrastructure and/or improve efficiency and boost productivity in the financial services sector.

name: Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics (AIDA) Grant
description: The Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics (AIDA) Grant was launched as part of the Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) scheme under the Financial Sector Development Fund (FSDF) to promote AIDA adoption and strengthen the ecosystem. It is specifically catered for projects that are focused on AIDA adoption with the objectives to improve decision making and/or generate better insights unlike other MAS grants for Financial Institutions and FinTechs. The FSTI scheme is valid until March 2026. Applications will be approved up to March 2026. Approved projects can run beyond March 2026.

name: Financial Training Scheme (FTS)
description: The Financial Training Scheme (FTS) provides funding for financial sector-specific training courses which are recognised under FTS and not accredited under the Skills Framework for Financial Services (SFwFS). This scheme is only available for company-sponsored individuals.

name: MAS FSTI Innovation Acceleration - Early Innovation
description: The MAS Financial Sector Technology and Innovation (FSTI) Innovation Acceleration Track provides funding support for experimentation, development and dissemination of nascent innovative technologies in the financial services sector. The FSTI Scheme is valid until March 2026.

name: Grant for Equity Market Singapore Scheme
description: MAS introduced the Grant for Equity Market Singapore (GEMS) scheme to support listings and expand the equity research ecosystem in our public equity market. GEMS has two components: (i) a Listing Grant that helps issuers defray listed related expenses; (ii) a Research Development Grant that supports research houses to enhance research coverage of Singapore-listed companies and boost the development of Singapore’s equity research ecosystem.

name: IBF Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS)
description: The IBF Standards Training Scheme ("IBF-STS") provides funding for training and assessment courses that cover key skills needed in the financial sector. Accredited under the Skills Framework for Financial Services (SFwFS). This scheme is available for both self-sponsored and company-sponsored individuals.

name: Regulatory Technology Grant
description: The Regulatory Technology (“RegTech”) Grant is part of the Financial Sector Transformation and Innovation (“FSTI”) scheme. It seeks to support financial institutions based in Singapore to enhance the efficiency of their risk management and compliance functions through the use of technological solutions.

name: Grants for Innovation
description: Get funding on proof-of-concepts, hiring, business development and more.

name: Digital Resilience Bonus
description: The Digital Resilience Bonus provides additional support of up to $10,000 for Food Services and Retail enterprises interested in leveraging digital tools and solutions to adapt to safe management practices. The payout will offset the cost of adopting digital solutions from three pre-defined categories, namely business process solutions, digital presence, and data-driven operations.
agency: SG Digital Office, Enterprise Singapore, Heartland Enterprise Centre Singapore (HECS)

name: Healthier Dining Grant (HDG)
description: The HDG is a co-funding scheme offered by HPB to support our HDP Partners in the promotion and publicity of healthier menu items. HPB will reimburse up to 80% of the qualifying costs incurred for producing in-store marketing materials and website/app amendments, up to the approved grant amount, subject to applicable terms and conditions.

name: Healthier Dining Innovation Grant (HDIG)
description: The HDIG is a grant offered by HPB to encourage innovation in the creation and promotion of healthier dining options. It supports projects that develop new healthier menu items or enhance existing ones.

name: Healthier Dining Grant
description: The Healthier Dining Grant (HDG) is a funding scheme designed to support F&B operators in offering healthier food and drink options. It provides financial assistance to reduce costs in areas such as research & development, purchase of healthier ingredients, culinary training, and recipe reformulation.

name: Healthier Dining Innovation Grant
description: The Healthier Dining Innovation Grant (HDIG) is a funding scheme of up to S$5,000, aimed at helping F&B operators to upgrade capabilities and undertake food-innovation related activities. It covers costs in research & development, purchase of healthier ingredients, culinary training, and recipe reformulation.

name: Healthier Choice Symbol Development Scheme (HDS)
description: Worth up to $200,000/project of grant support to support the R&D of products to obtain the Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) certification. HDS is offered for products that are not yet HCS certified.

name: Go-To-Market Scheme (GTMS)
description: Worth up to $300,000/year of grant support to support the commercialisation and marketing of Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) products. GTMS is offered for products that are already HCS certified.

name: Healthier Choice Symbol Development Scheme (HDS)
description: Worth up to $200,000/project of grant support to support the R&D of products to obtain the Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) certification. HDS is offered for products that are not yet HCS certified.

name: Go-To-Market Scheme (GTMS)
description: Worth up to $300,000/year of grant support to support the commercialisation and marketing of Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) products. GTMS is offered for products that are already HCS certified.

name: Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG)
description: Eligible SMEs can receive funding support from the Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG) or other relevant grants to implement digital solutions in the Marine and Offshore Engineering IDP.

name: Refundable Investment Credit (RIC)
description: The Refundable Investment Credit (RIC) encourages companies to undertake substantive and high-value economic activities in Singapore. The RIC is a tax credit with a refundable cash feature, designed to be consistent with the Global Anti-Base Erosion ("GloBE") rules for Qualified Refundable Tax Credits. The RIC activities and expenditure categories are aligned with the four pillars of our Singapore Economy 2030 vision (i.e. trade, enterprise, manufacturing and services) and our green transition goals.

name: Pioneer Certificate Incentive (PC) & Development and Expansion Incentive (DEI)
description: The Pioneer Certificate Incentive (PC) and the Development and Expansion Incentive (DEI) aim to encourage companies to grow capabilities and conduct new or expanded economic activities in Singapore. Companies that carry out global or regional headquarters (HQ) activities of managing, coordinating and controlling business activities for a group of companies may also apply for DEI for the HQ activities.

name: Finance & Treasury Centre (FTC) Incentive
description: The Finance and Treasury Centre (FTC) Incentive aims to encourage companies to grow treasury management capabilities and use Singapore as a base for conducting strategic finance and treasury management activities.

name: Aircraft Leasing Scheme (ALS) & Aircraft Investment Manager (AIM) Incentive
description: The Aircraft Leasing Scheme (ALS) and Aircraft Investment Manager (AIM) Incentive aim to encourage companies to develop aircraft leasing capabilities and grow the aircraft leasing industry in Singapore.

name: Intellectual Property (IP) Development Incentive (IDI)
description: The IP Development Incentive (IDI) aims to encourage the use and commercialisation of intellectual property rights arising from research and development (R&D) activities.

name: Partnerships for Capability Transformation (PACT) Scheme
description: This scheme was introduced to help original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), and their suppliers cover a portion of costs related to equipment, materials, testing, and professional services.

name: Research and Innovation Scheme for Companies (RIS(C))
description: The Research and Innovation Scheme for Companies (RIS(C)) aims to encourage companies’ technology development and innovation activities, to bring about the development of product and processes from Singapore.

name: Tech@SG Programme
description: The Tech@SG Programme aims to help fast-growing companies establish their core teams in Singapore and more quickly capture business opportunities here and in the region. Jointly administered by EDB and Enterprise Singapore, the programme will facilitate the entry of global technology talent for eligible companies.
agency: Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and Enterprise Singapore

name: Tech.Pass
description: Tech.Pass is a visa that allows established tech entrepreneurs, leaders or technical experts from around the world to come to Singapore to perform frontier and disruptive innovations. The pass is administered by the Singapore Economic Development Board.

name: Training Grant for Company (TGC)
description: The Training Grant for Company (TGC) aims to encourage manpower capability development in applying new technologies, industrial skills and professional know-how through the support of training programmes for companies’ employees.

name: Resource Efficiency Grant for Emissions (REG(E))
description: The Resource Efficiency Grant for Emissions (REG(E)) encourage manufacturing companies and data centres to invest in projects that improve energy efficiency, reduce non-CO2 Greenhouse Gases (“GHG”) consumption or other forms of eligible emissions reduction.

name: Land Intensification Allowance (LIA)
description: The Land Intensification Allowance (LIA) aims to encourage the intensification of industrial land use towards more land-efficient and higher value-added activities.

name: Sustainability Reporting Grant (SRG)
description: The Sustainability Reporting Grant (SRG) aims to provide funding support for companies to cover a portion of their costs in producing their first sustainability report in Singapore that is to be consistent with the International Sustainability Standards Board’s (ISSB) standards.

name: Carbon Project Development Grant
description: The grant aims to support companies in performing early-stage carbon project development and financing activities that could generate high-quality Article 6 carbon credits. The grant also seeks to support Singapore-based carbon project developers in establishing project development capabilities in Singapore and further nurture Singapore’s carbon services ecosystem.

name: Maritime Cluster Fund (MCF)
description: Introduced by the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA), the Maritime Cluster Fund (MCF) facilitates the growth of Singapore's maritime cluster by supporting the industry's manpower and business development efforts as well as its drive for productivity improvements. There are three key components under MCF.
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: MCF-Manpower Development
description: The MCF-Manpower Development co-funds maritime companies in the development of manpower, training initiatives and capabilities.
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: MCF-Business Development
description: The MCF-Business Development supports eligible expenses incurred in the setting up of new maritime operations or expansion into new lines of maritime businesses in Singapore, and internationalisation efforts by maritime companies.
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: MCF-Productivity
description: The MCF-Productivity supports initiatives by the maritime industry that will lead to productivity gains. (The MCF-Productivity scheme is under review and currently not accepting new applications.)
agency: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore

name: Service and Job Transformation Leadership Programme (SJTL)
description: The programme aims to equip the service industry leaders with problem solving tools and techniques to decrease reliance on manpower, innovate and improve productivity through service design. Enterprises can learn about applicable service design tools and techniques, best practices through overseas company visits and Job redesign methods to future proof their businesses.

name: A job redesign grant for all sectors (PSG-JR)
description: Work with pre-approved job redesign consultants to redesign jobs and enhance workforce productivity. Benefits include customised job redesign solutions, funding support capped at $30,000, and job redesign consultancy support.

name: Accountancy Job Redesign Initiative
description: Helps enterprises to enhance the roles of F&A professionals and adopt technology to improve the function’s productivity. Benefits include funding for JR consultancy costs and increasing the value of F&A job roles.

name: Capability Transfer Programme
description: Acquire and transfer global capabilities from foreign specialists to your local workforce. Benefits include localising global capabilities, developing local workforce with new skills, and receiving funding support.

name: Tech-and-GO! Start Digital
description: Supports funding for IT solutions that are pre-scoped solutions from approved vendors or Green Lane.

name: Tech-and-GO! Go Digital
description: Supports agencies adopting non-pre-scoped/large-scale IT solutions to better resource utilisation and increase productivity.

name: Tech-and-GO! Grow Digital
description: Enables agencies to adopt non-pre-scoped/large-scale IT solutions that benefit clients or service productivity.

name: Tech-and-GO! Consultancy Subsidy
description: Explore a range of consultancy services to develop and implement a digital strategy for agencies evolving IT needs.

name: Charities Capability Fund Info-Communications Technology Grant (Cat A)
description: Supports small & medium sized social service agencies for basic infrastructure components such as laptops, printers, etc.

name: Business Events in Singapore (BEiS)
description: The Business Events in Singapore (BEiS) scheme aims to attract and grow high-quality events in Singapore in the long term, as well as catalyse the innovation of new content. BEiS also supports activities that will build the foundation for quality business events in Singapore in the long term.

name: Local Enterprise and Association Development Programme (LEAD)
Tourism Product Development Fund (TPDF)
description: The page for the Tourism Product Development Fund (TPDF) might have been moved or deleted. Try searching for this page instead.
